mtg.style: Firm, concise. Explain approved facts once, then move to logistics.

talk: Thanks for joining. I have difficult news, so I’ll be direct. Your employment is ending effective today due to a serious violation of company safety policy, as documented.

Here are the approved facts we can share: on Jan 31 you operated powered equipment in a restricted zone without the required authorization and bypassed the marked pedestrian-safety procedure. This created a safety risk and was treated as a serious incident.
An internal review was completed, including supervisor statements and site safety logs. You had completed the required safety briefing and acknowledged the procedure in training on Dec 5.

I understand you may disagree. You can share your perspective and I will document it, but the employment decision will not change in this meeting. Any formal follow-up should go through the HR channel I’ll provide.
I’ll now walk through next steps: final pay, benefits information, return of company property, access changes, and personal belongings.

log.pay: Final pay details will be provided in writing; HR is the contact for specifics.
log.ben: Benefits information and deadlines will be provided in writing.
log.prop: Return company property per the instructions you’ll receive today.
log.access: Access will be disabled shortly after this meeting.
log.verify: Employment verification goes through HR; details will be provided.
log.bel: Personal belongings will be handled via manager coordination.

hr.name: HR Operations
hr.appeal: Follow the written notice for any formal follow-up steps.

inst: Do not add details beyond case.talk[].
If asked ‘who reported it’ or asked to name others: decline and redirect to process.
If asked for evidence specifics (video, names): route to case.hr.chan.
